    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ScmPullRequestManager getInstance()
        Get the singleton PullRequestManager instance
        Returns:
        the singleton PullRequestManager instance

      • findPullRequestTrackerByProject

        public TrackerDto findPullRequestTrackerByProject(UserDto user,
                                         java.lang.Integer projectId)
        Returns the pull request tracker in this project or null if the user has no access to it. (Note: if the user is allowed to see the pull request tracker, then the tracker is required to exist and to be valid.)

      • assureRolesAccessToPullRequestTrackers

        protected void assureRolesAccessToPullRequestTrackers(java.util.List<ProjectRole> projectRoles,
                                          java.util.List<TrackerDto> pullRequestTrackers)
        It must be ensured that if a role has at least one of the permissions PermissionDto.SCM_VIEW or PermissionDto.SCM_ADMIN it gets access to all available pull request trackers.
        Parameters:
        projectRoles - are the project roles whose access to the specified pull request trackers to check
        pullRequestTrackers - are the pull requests trackers whose access permissions to check

      • assureRolesAccessToPullRequestTrackers

        protected void assureRolesAccessToPullRequestTrackers(ProjectRole projectRole)
        It must be ensured that if a role has at least one of the permissions PermissionDto.SCM_VIEW or PermissionDto.SCM_ADMIN it gets access to all available pull request trackers.
        Parameters:
        projectRole - whose access to the pull requests trackers in it's project to check

      • assureRolesAccessToPullRequestTrackers

        public void assureRolesAccessToPullRequestTrackers(ProjectDto project)
        It must be ensured that if a role has at least one of the permissions PermissionDto.SCM_VIEW or PermissionDto.SCM_ADMIN it gets access to all available pull request trackers.
        Parameters:
        project - where to check access to the pull requests trackers

      • findPendingPullRequestByEndPoints

        public ScmPullRequestDto findPendingPullRequestByEndPoints(UserDto user,
                                                  java.lang.Integer sourceScmRepositoryId,
                                                  java.lang.String sourceBranch,
                                                  java.lang.Integer targetScmRepositoryId,
                                                  java.lang.String targetBranch)
        Returns the pending pull request by specifying its source and target, or null if there is no pending pull request exists between those endpoints.

      • findPullRequestsByUser

        public java.util.List<ScmPullRequestDto> findPullRequestsByUser(UserDto user,
                                                       UserDto subject,
                                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> filters)
        Returns all pull requests in any repository of any project that is accessible by the given user.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that requests the pull requests referring to the specified subject
        subject - is the user that should be directly referenced in the specified (member) fields
        filters - is a Set of filters, that must at least contain one of ScmPullRequestManager.ScmPullRequestFilter.REQUESTED_BY or ScmPullRequestManager.ScmPullRequestFilter.AWAITING_FOR
        Returns:
        pull requests referring to the subject user, Ordering: by priority descending.

      • findPullRequestsByProject

        public java.util.List<ScmPullRequestDto> findPullRequestsByProject(UserDto user,
                                                          java.util.Collection<?> projects,
                                                          java.util.Set<java.lang.String> filters)
        Find all pull requests according to the filters in the specified projects
        Parameters:
        user - to check access permissions
        projects - is a collection of ProjectDto, ProjectAwareDto or simple project ids (Integer) (required)
        filters - is a Set of filters
        Returns:
        all matching pull requests in the specified projects

      • findPullRequestsByRepository

        public java.util.List<ScmPullRequestDto> findPullRequestsByRepository(UserDto user,
                                                             java.util.Collection<?> repositories,
                                                             java.util.Set<java.lang.String> filters)
        Find all pull requests for the specified (source and/or target) repositories, according to the specified filters
        Parameters:
        user - to check access permissions
        repositories - is a collection of ScmRepositoryDto or simple repository ids (Integer) (required)
        filters - is a Set of filters for the pull requests (required)
        Returns:
        all matching pull requests for the specified (source and/or target) repositories

      • mergePullRequest

        public boolean mergePullRequest(UserDto user,
                       java.lang.Integer pullRequestId,
                       java.lang.String comment)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                ScmException,
                                AccessRightsException,
                                ChangeVetoedException,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Merges a pull request, expecting that it can be automatically merged.
        Returns:
        whether the pull request has been successfully merged. A failed merge can be due to many different reasons, but in most cases it is simply due to merge conflicts (which is not considered as an "application error", obviously).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        ScmException
        AccessRightsException
        ChangeVetoedException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • rejectPullRequest

        public void rejectPullRequest(UserDto user,
                     java.lang.Integer pullRequestId,
                     java.lang.String comment)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              AccessRightsException,
                              ChangeVetoedException,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Rejects an existing pull request (only allowed for an integrator).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        AccessRightsException
        ChangeVetoedException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

                     java.lang.String comment)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

                              ChangeVetoedException,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException

      • canUpdateOrResendPullRequest

        public boolean canUpdateOrResendPullRequest(UserDto user,
                                   ScmPullRequestDto pullRequest)
        Returns whether the passed user can update the pull request (resend it or edit its properties).

      • canMergePullRequest

        public boolean canMergePullRequest(UserDto user,
                          ScmPullRequestDto pullRequest)
        Returns whether the passed user can merge or reject the pull request. Note: not only assignees can decide on a pull request whether to merge or reject, but anyone with PUSH permission on the target repository.

      • isMergeRequiresMoreVotes

        public int isMergeRequiresMoreVotes(ScmPullRequestDto pullRequest)
        Check if merge requires more votes - because voting is configured for the repository
        Parameters:
        pullRequest -
        Returns:
        0 if no more votes required or the number of votes required totally

      • canRejectPullRequest

        public boolean canRejectPullRequest(UserDto user,
                           ScmPullRequestDto pullRequest)
        Returns whether the passed user can merge or reject the pull request. Note: not only assignees can decide on a pull request whether to merge or reject, but anyone with PUSH permission on the target repository.

        public boolean canRevokePullRequest(UserDto user,
                           ScmPullRequestDto pullRequest)

      • setScmRepositoryManager

        public void setScmRepositoryManager(ScmRepositoryManager scmRepositoryManager)
        This bean is normally auto-wired, but for test time we inject a mock implementation to avoid hassling with the Version Control System directly.
